title: tests in TestCopyRange fail on ppc64le with "inappropriate ioctl for device"

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: build
labels.description: Issues caused by or requiring changes to the build system (scripts or Docker image)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

milestone.title: v1.9.0
milestone.description: This release adds the advanced folder option `caseSensitiveFS` (https://docs.syncthing.net/advanced/folder-caseSensitiveFS.html) to disable the new safe handling of case insensitive filesystems.

body:
From an attempted 1.8.0 build on fedora rawhide (with go 1.15, but using `-tags noquic` where necessary):

```
go test -buildmode pie -compiler gc -ldflags ' -extldflags '\''-Wl,-z,relro -Wl,--as-needed  -Wl,-z,now -specs=/usr/lib/rpm/redhat/redhat-hardened-ld '\''' github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/fs
--- FAIL: TestCopyRange (1.28s)
    --- FAIL: TestCopyRange/tmp (1.28s)
        --- FAIL: TestCopyRange/tmp/ioctl (0.22s)
            --- FAIL: TestCopyRange/tmp/ioctl/append_to_end (0.02s)
                filesystem_copy_range_test.go:332: inappropriate ioctl for device
            --- FAIL: TestCopyRange/tmp/ioctl/append_to_end_offsets_at_start (0.02s)
                filesystem_copy_range_test.go:332: inappropriate ioctl for device
            --- FAIL: TestCopyRange/tmp/ioctl/overwrite_part_of_destination_region (0.02s)
                filesystem_copy_range_test.go:332: inappropriate ioctl for device
            --- FAIL: TestCopyRange/tmp/ioctl/overwrite_all_of_destination (0.02s)
                filesystem_copy_range_test.go:332: inappropriate ioctl for device
            --- FAIL: TestCopyRange/tmp/ioctl/overwrite_part_of_destination (0.02s)
                filesystem_copy_range_test.go:332: inappropriate ioctl for device
            --- FAIL: TestCopyRange/tmp/ioctl/destination_gets_expanded_as_it_is_being_written_to (0.02s)
                filesystem_copy_range_test.go:332: inappropriate ioctl for device
            --- FAIL: TestCopyRange/tmp/ioctl/unaligned_source_offset_unaligned_size (0.01s)
                filesystem_copy_range_test.go:332: inappropriate ioctl for device
            --- FAIL: TestCopyRange/tmp/ioctl/unaligned_source_offset_aligned_size (0.01s)
                filesystem_copy_range_test.go:332: inappropriate ioctl for device
            --- FAIL: TestCopyRange/tmp/ioctl/unaligned_destination_offset_unaligned_size (0.02s)
                filesystem_copy_range_test.go:332: inappropriate ioctl for device
            --- FAIL: TestCopyRange/tmp/ioctl/unaligned_destination_offset_aligned_size (0.02s)
                filesystem_copy_range_test.go:332: inappropriate ioctl for device
            --- FAIL: TestCopyRange/tmp/ioctl/aligned_offsets_unaligned_size (0.02s)
                filesystem_copy_range_test.go:332: inappropriate ioctl for device
            --- FAIL: TestCopyRange/tmp/ioctl/last_block (0.01s)
                filesystem_copy_range_test.go:332: inappropriate ioctl for device
            --- FAIL: TestCopyRange/tmp/ioctl/whole_file_copy_block_aligned (0.01s)
                filesystem_copy_range_test.go:332: inappropriate ioctl for device
            --- FAIL: TestCopyRange/tmp/ioctl/whole_file_copy_not_block_aligned (0.01s)
                filesystem_copy_range_test.go:332: inappropriate ioctl for device
FAIL
FAIL	github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/fs	1.604s
FAIL
```

Looks like the ioctl that's used for the new copyRange functionality is not available on ppc64le / POWER.
The build succeeds on all other architectures supported by fedora (x86_64, i686, armv7hl / armhfp, aarch64, s390x / System Z).
